message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with the problem of selecting a small set of vertices in a graph to activate a given number of vertices within a prescribed number of rounds. This problem is motivated by social network analysis, where the objective is to spread information or influence through a network within a limited time frame. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The paper also discusses the hardness of the problem and gives exact polynomial time algorithms for graphs of bounded clique-width and exact linear time algorithms for trees. This suggests that the paper may also belong to sub-categories such as cs.SOC (Social and Behavioral Sciences), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics), and cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory).
